hero.title: Understanding Egypt's Heritage
hero.description: Learn about the classification of archaeological sites, Egypt's historical timeline, and the importance of cultural preservation.

classification.title: How Archaeological Sites Are Classified
classification.intro: Archaeological sites in Egypt are classified based on several key criteria that help researchers and visitors understand their historical context and significance:

chronological.title: Chronological Period
chronological.description: Sites are categorized by the historical era in which they were constructed or primarily used, from Prehistoric times through the Islamic period.

function.title: Function & Purpose
function.description: Classification includes temples, tombs, fortifications, settlements, and administrative centers based on their original function.

significance.title: Cultural Significance
significance.description: Sites are evaluated for their historical importance, architectural innovation, and contribution to understanding ancient civilizations.

preservation.title: Preservation State
preservation.description: Documentation includes the current condition, from well-preserved structures to archaeological ruins requiring ongoing conservation.

preservationImportance.title: Cultural Preservation
preservationImportance.description: Preserving Egypt's archaeological heritage is crucial for maintaining the connection between past and present civilizations. These sites provide invaluable insights into human development, architectural innovation, and cultural evolution.

research.title: For Researchers & Students
research.description: This platform serves as an educational resource for academic research, classroom learning, and independent study of Egyptian archaeology.

features.siteDescriptions: Comprehensive site descriptions and historical context

research.targetAudienceList: Students, Researchers, Tourists, History Enthusiasts, Educators, and Cultural Institutions
